verbs.description: plastics [V: have] entered human food chain study shows bits of plastic have been detected in the faeces of people in europe russia and japan according to research claiming to show for the first time the widespread presence of plastics in the human food chain plastics researcher university of york afp global gastrointestinal tract britain philipp schwabl japan bettina liebmann king college london italy alistair boxall vienna europe food medical university of vienna netherlands federal environment agency professor finland austria russia stephanie wright poland
